snippet: State Attorney General Bill Schuette said Thaddeus McCotter, a Republican, was “asleep at the switch” when four of his staff members forged or falsified signatures on nominating petitions.
abstract: Former aides to Michigan Rep Thaddeus McCotter are expected to be arraigned on charges including forgery and conspiracy for falsifying signatures on nominating petitions; McCotter himself will not be charged, though he draws criticism for his lack of oversight.
lead_paragraph: State Attorney General Bill Schuette said Thaddeus McCotter, a Republican, was “asleep at the switch” when four of his staff members forged or falsified signatures on nominating petitions.
